topic.title: INCANTATA - news, discussion, art submissions
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13VDeMgRgGf73mHsMrrorXkq4fhUKfBvPz/ (DE)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/19xqgCi5YTsdTxY97Pferz9GuQERzSSVFe/ (En)

Incantata is an elaborated free (libre) trading card game with a delicate balance and focus on competitive play. It is a ZeroNet only project - to bring joy and quality content to Zeronet.

topic.title: preconstructed incantata decks
topic.body:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1KYeh8RtfQViD9k7J2QeJMLgT9vKrANrX9/ (DE)

only in german for now, but you can copy the links and replace the base url with the english site (http://127.0.0.1:43110/19xqgCi5YTsdTxY97Pferz9GuQERzSSVFe/), so it should work.

topic.title: art submissions & rewards
topic.body:
Art submissions are very welcome and a good way to contribute to the Incantata project without any technical knowlege. Check out the english page for more information (hint for artists).
Rewards for art submissions are cryptocards (obyte tokens)
Right now the sponsorship for art submissions are free, so if you want to participate you just need to paint something.

topic.title: Cryptocard Giveaway
topic.body:
Post your Obyte address above the latest giveaway post - first post counts! (only one per id/address)

(( 
- Obyte is a blockchainless cryptothingy, which is used to mint Incantata tokens - nothing serious, just for fun and collecting. It has TOR-support build in and has a funky (and maybe clunky ;) ) wallet.

- You can generate an obyte address offline, fe with a live system (if in doubt)

- Remember: you can use this script (pls. read the code, just sqlite inserts) to add the token names to your wallet:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13VDeMgRgGf73mHsMrrorXkq4fhUKfBvPz/set_asset_names.sh
usage #bash set_asset_names.sh 
))

topic.title: hints for printing
topic.body:
check out the topic "precontstructed incantata decks" and open the print pages. 
- chromium: scale 114%; enable backgrounds; disable header/footer; borders minimum
- firefox/torBrowser: scale 76%; disable header/footer; all margins 0 (check about:config -> margin)

topic.title: Is it possible to have peer-whitelists for specific (owned/not owned) sites?
is zeronet also working with segwit addresses?
topic.body: means: can i generate a page based on a (somehow outside generated) segwit compatible address?

topic.title: how can i connect a site to local nodes (lan/wlan)?
topic.body: esp. if there is no connection to the internet. Is a local tracker needed, or is there some other possibility?

1560968857_1EBYmm4sYxPoUVKAYFLfmYR6opizG.body:
> [xmj5tnj7ply424a7](#comment_8_1GnMepQGSHSi7yBqqi86T65hRgon3KyJtS): http://127.0.0.1:43110/Styromaniac.blocklist.bit [...]

to have control over some sites which aren't ment for public, f.e. a private chat site

or, more a future thing: blocking "scan bots", or things like that

> [xmj5tnj7ply424a7](#comment_10_1GnMepQGSHSi7yBqqi86T65hRgon3KyJtS): I can see a purpose for it, maybe if you want a local-only site, or VPN-only (as in Virtual Private Network, not to access the internet) [...]

yes , 0-chat-sites with end-to-end encryption (via zeroid keys) would also be good , but blocking automatic scanning would still be useful.

> [xmj5tnj7ply424a7](#comment_11_1GnMepQGSHSi7yBqqi86T65hRgon3KyJtS): There is ZeroMail you could use

didn't managed to get a clone of it running...

> [xmj5tnj7ply424a7](#comment_11_1GnMepQGSHSi7yBqqi86T65hRgon3KyJtS): There is ZeroMail you could use

stumbled upon 0 media , which is pretty much the thing i would want to manage a decentralized communication system. Easy to clone and simple, but no end to end encryption (but i guess it is doable ). but in the end... a peer whitelisting/blacklisting would still be good...

thx for your attention

1560988180_1CKKbdH99PeFfraMKFZNmCMAUsTfT.body:
you may want to have a look at Incantata http://127.0.0.1:43110/19xqgCi5YTsdTxY97Pferz9GuQERzSSVFe (en)
http://127.0.0.1:43110/13VDeMgRgGf73mHsMrrorXkq4fhUKfBvPz (de)
A creative common card game exclusively made for zeronet.
It is under constant developement and player made artwork is always welcome!
Besides being a competitive card game, it is an experiment for decentralized collaboration and crypto art.

1561983082_1EBYmm4sYxPoUVKAYFLfmYR6opizG.body: and if not,        <u>i put it on the wish list</u>

> [filips](#comment_37_1LFu1BTScmY82HHtg3TY2jAuSrCYNsQWEY): I don't know if SegWit is supported, but there is PR for multiple cryptographies:https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/pull/2053 [...]

thx a lot , i guess it is not the most important thing, but it would be nice if zeronet would stay bitcoin-core compatible.
thx for your post on github!

> [zeroid2](#comment_6_1JXyjZA9UNFKzzawz4o5MPbb5PFaumF1cK): Are people really using their Bitcoin addresses for ZeroNet sites? I thought we only used secp256k1 for its use in Bitcoin not to be compatible with Bitcoin addresses.

not really as a wallet, but you can recieve donation via your zite-address, so a sewit address for a zite would be nice.

check the donations for the hello page for example: https://btc.chaintools.io/address/1HeLLo4uzjaLetFx6NH3PMwFP3qbRbTf3D/

> [zeroid2](#comment_7_1JXyjZA9UNFKzzawz4o5MPbb5PFaumF1cK): This could also be fixed using a donation address in the content.json file. No need to support different crypto in ZeroNet

i would appreciate it , so it is "one address to rule them" (import to bitcoin-wallet, signing, verify, encrypt) etc.
but if not... so shall it be :)

1562233720_1EBYmm4sYxPoUVKAYFLfmYR6opizG.body:
i simple way to achieve this would be very much appreaciated, esp. for mesh networks, etc.

edit: or for the case that the network is so much restricted, that the only way to distribute zeronet pages is to form temporary mesh-clouds and local lan/wlan zeronet-parties :)

> [nofish](#comment_1277_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is a built-in local peer discovery (UDP broadcasting based), but if it's not working in your network, then: [...]

thank you very much, that sounds great! (so, at least zeronet is internet-meltdown-safe ;) )
